pr_title: Use proper connector session in ConnectorNodePartitioningProvider

timeline.bodyText:
There are many places where session.toConnectorSession() is called, and only one is updated.
Would it make sense to have a test ensuring at least the "connector partitioning interface" use-cases is working end to end?
timeline.author: findepi
timeline.diffHunk:
@@ -221,7 +221,7 @@ private ConnectorBucketNodeMap getConnectorBucketNodeMap(Session session, Partit
 
         ToIntFunction<ConnectorSplit> splitBucketFunction = partitioningProvider.getSplitBucketFunction(
                 partitioningHandle.getTransactionHandle().orElse(null),
-                session.toConnectorSession(),
+                session.toConnectorSession(partitioningHandle.getConnectorId().get()),

replies.bodyText: The title is confusing, I just test one method ConnectorNodePartitioningProvider#getSplitBucketFunction, it cannot fetch the session properties.
replies.author: Crossoverrr

replies.bodyText: Could you add a test for that? Indeed there is one more call in NodePartitioningManager#getConnectorBucketNodeMap that does't use toConnectorSession(partitioningHandle.getConnectorId().get())
replies.author: sopel39

replies.bodyText: Well, I saw method Session#toConnectorSession has been tested in presto test code, do we really need a test for that?   :)
replies.author: Crossoverrr

replies.bodyText: I think it won't be null, for it is checked in the previous code.
replies.author: Crossoverrr

timeline.bodyText: change commit title: Use proper connector session in ConnectorNodePartitioningProvider
timeline.author: sopel39

timeline.message: Use proper connector session in ConnectorNodePartitioningProvider
